column3: str
Hello there, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Have you come with a delivery today, or did you perhaps care for a spot of tea?

Ah, 'tis good to see you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I trust the procurement of the various odds and ends for the study abroad program proceeds apace? I am beside myself with anticipation to see what wonders you will bring!

Thank you for your continued support as always, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. As I know all too well from my time as a student, 'tis nigh impossible to concentrate on an empty stomachーhence why I've a mind to keep some aetherothermal lunch boxes at hand, if I could trouble you with the task of procuring them?

Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>ーseeing you always puts me at ease. If you're ever in need of a respite, you are always welcome here. As we discussed earlier, I would like as many mammets as you can prepare to aid students having trouble with magicks.

Welcome, welcome! I was just thinking of you. You <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> stop by when you can, won't you? Even if it's just for a spot of tea, seeing that you are safe and sound puts my heart at ease.
What will you do?
Make a delivery (<Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> remaining).
Cast glamour on Ameliance.
Learn about custom deliveries.
Nothing.
What would you learn more about?
Satisfaction level.
Delivery requirements and rewards.
Procuring collectables.
Acquiring materials.
Increasing the value of crafted collectables.
Increasing the value of gathered collectables.
Increasing the value of fish.
Nothing.
With each successful delivery, Ameliance will come to trust you more and more, leading her to task you with assignments of greater importance.

This will be displayed in the form of a gauge atop the Custom Deliveries list. Fill this gauge to the maximum, and Ameliance's <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>satisfaction level<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>─as represented by little golden hearts─will increase.

Upon reaching a new <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>satisfaction level<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, you will have the opportunity to learn more about Ameliance and her efforts to further establish the study abroad program at the Studium.
In order to deliver an item, you must be its corresponding class and level 80 or above.
If you are level 89 or below, you will be awarded experience points instead of the level 90 scrips reward.
Should you find yourself unsure as to how to procure a particular item, subcommands and item descriptions can point you in the right direction.

For Disciple of the Hand items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Crafting Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand with the list selected will bring up the crafting log and the recipe for the item in question.

Likewise, for Disciple of the Land items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Gathering Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand will bring up the gathering log.
For knowledge on fish and fishing holes, refer to the item descriptions displayed when the list is selected.

The items sought by Ameliance fall into three categories: crafted items (obtainable by Disciples of the Hand), gathered items (obtainable by Disciples of the Land), and fish. Furthermore, Ameliance deals only in <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>collectables<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
Materials necessary to craft the collectables Ameliance seeks may be purchased from Synnove in the Agora.

The collectability of crafted items is directly related to their quality. Spare no effort in ensuring that the items you craft are of the highest possible quality, and you will be rewarded accordingly.

The <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Inner Quiet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> status, granted each time you successfully increase quality, will serve you particularly well.

Accumlate as many stacks of the status as you can, then put the final flourish on your masterpiece with <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Byregot's Blessing<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

There are a host of other actions that can serve to further enhance the quality of items you craft. Once you've mastered the fundamentals, you are encouraged to experiment with varied approaches until you find your preferred crafting approach.
Before gathering a collectable item, you must increase its collectability.

One technique miners and botanists may employ to raise collectability is the use of <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Scrutiny<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> followed by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Scour<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>. Try executing this combination a few times before gathering the item.

Gatherers seeking to procure items with higher collectability must be certain to equip gear with higher <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>gathering<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> and <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>perception<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> ratings, as these attributes influence the effectiveness of actions that raise collectability.

Of course, these actions cannot be used to their full potential without sufficient <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>GP<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>. A healthy balance of all three attributes is essential to make the most of your gathering.
The collectability value of fish follows a simple rule─the bigger, the better.

Upon arriving at the fishing hole where your desired quarry resides, use the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Collect<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> action, then begin fishing.

From there, using <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Patience II<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> followed by effective hooking actions will increase your chances of reeling in a big one.

Should you still find yourself catching only small fry, try outfitting yourself with better equipment to raise your <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>perception<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

The items sought by Ameliance fall into three categories: crafted items (obtainable by Disciples of the Hand), gathered items (obtainable by Disciples of the Land), and fish. Furthermore, Ameliance deals only in <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>collectables<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
In order to deliver an item, you must be its corresponding class and level 80 or above.
If you are level 89 or below, you will be awarded experience points instead of the level 90 scrips reward.
Information on how to find individual items may be found in the following manner.

For Disciple of the Hand items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Crafting Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand with the list selected will bring up the crafting log and the recipe for the item in question.
Materials necessary to craft the collectables Ameliance seeks may be purchased from Synnove in the Agora.

Likewise, for Disciple of the Land items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Gathering Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand will bring up the gathering log.
For knowledge on fish and fishing holes, refer to the item descriptions displayed when the list is selected.
The higher an item's collectability, the greater the reward you will earn from Ameliance upon successful delivery.

To learn more about collectables and how to increase collectability, speak with Ameliance and select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Learn about custom deliveries<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
In making your first successful delivery, you have begun to earn Ameliance's trust.

With each successful delivery, Ameliance will grow more and more satisfied with your efforts. Fill the gauge completely and Ameliance's <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>satisfaction level<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> will increase, giving you the opportunity to learn more about your new business partner.
You can make up to six deliveries in a given week. Deliver the items Ameliance needs, and deliver them often to win the trust and praise of your new business partner!

You have reached the weekly limit for deliveries. You may begin again starting <ResetTime>1203</ResetTime><Switch(TopLevelParameter(220))><Case(1)>Sunday</Case><Case(2)>Monday</Case><Case(3)>Tuesday</Case><Case(4)>Wednesday</Case><Case(5)>Thursday</Case><Case(6)>Friday</Case><Case(7)>Saturday</Case></Switch> at <If(TopLevelParameter(218))><Switch(TopLevelParameter(218))><Case(1)>1</Case><Case(2)>2</Case><Case(3)>3</Case><Case(4)>4</Case><Case(5)>5</Case><Case(6)>6</Case><Case(7)>7</Case><Case(8)>8</Case><Case(9)>9</Case><Case(10)>10</Case><Case(11)>11</Case><Case(12)>12</Case><Case(13)>1</Case><Case(14)>2</Case><Case(15)>3</Case><Case(16)>4</Case><Case(17)>5</Case><Case(18)>6</Case><Case(19)>7</Case><Case(20)>8</Case><Case(21)>9</Case><Case(22)>10</Case><Case(23)>11</Case></Switch><Else/>12</If> <If(GreaterThanOrEqualTo(TopLevelParameter(218),12))>p.m.<Else/>a.m.</If> (Earth time).

Students will need the finest writing utensils for not only taking notes on lectures, but transcribing ritual procedures and jotting down spells. The greater the aetherial conductivity of the instrument, the more conducive it will be to their studies.

Students of the magical arts require an appropriate foci through which to hone their skillsーwhether it's an array of nouliths, a planisphere, cane, or magical concoction, there are numerous optionsーassuming the quality is satisfactory. What have you brought for me today, pray tell?

As a Sharlayan, I am all too aware of our propensity to prioritize nutrition over flavor in our cuisine, but thanks to interactions with students from abroad, no small few Sharlayans have developed an interest in the cooking of other cultures. If you could procure lunch boxes capable of preserving the temperature of food, I would be most grateful.

Mammets are an invaluable tool for helping students to gauge their command over aetherial manipulation, and it is paramount that the mammet be highly conductive to aether for clear results. The materials used to make them, from the core to the smallest details like the mammet's clothing, must be equally conductive to aether.
The regions hit worst by the Final Days are in dire need of school supplies, and I've a mind to send what provisions I can. Items with a long shelf life are preferred, but every little thing helps.

When writing the particulars of a spell or ritual on parchment, much like ink, a quill highly conductive to aether will provide the best results. As feathers are the key component, I'd be happy to ascertain the aetheroconductivity of any you have on hand.

As you undoubtedly already know, crystals are the primary catalyst of magical fociーand the purer the crystal, the greater its potency. Procuring such quality of crystal, however, is no trifling task...

I find that people engrossed in their work have a tendency to forget to eat when they shouldーand students are no exception. That is why I wish to provide them with aetherothermal lunch boxes, capable of keeping food fresh for hours on end. Any materials with insulative properties you have at hand are welcome.

Mammets require a healthy supply of lubricating oils to keep their joints in good order. Not just any lubricant will do, howeverーthe more impurities in the oil, the less responsive it will be to aetherial manipulation.

The regions hit worst by the Final Days are in dire need of school supplies, and I would provide aid in whatever small way I can. To that end, I would like highly durable materials capable of being used in any environment.

Writing ink is made from a complex process involving the mixture of a unique solution, from which the resultant precipitate is then extracted. Naturally, the better the ingredients, the better the ink will feel to use.
Toads have a variety of uses, but at the Studium, they are primarily used as familiars. Should you happen upon a particularly shrewd one, it would make for a fine familiar indeed!

A beautiful, well-designed lunch box has the subconcious effect of increasing one's appetite, would you not agree? Well, most Sharlayans would not. The students, however, would undoubtedly appreciate the gesture!

I wonder, were you aware that a mammet's eyes are generally made of a light-emitting material? I shudder to recall the time I caught a pair of such bright little eyes glowering at me in the darknessー'twas a rather traumatizing experience. As for why mammets are constructed in this way, there are a number of purported reasonsーone such being that it allows them to function in environments void of light.

The satrap of Radz–at–Han has graciously offered  his full consent for natural resources from Thavnair to be dispersed worldwide and used in the creation of educational materialsーall to provide aid to other calamity-struck nations. A high-quality coral would surely produce a brilliant chalk color capable of brightening any child's day!
I just knew you wouldn't disappoint, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I am happy to report I have no qualms with the qualityーI'm sure it will suit our purposes just fine!

Oh my, this looks to be of remarkable quality! I cannot thank you enough for going above and beyond like this... I suspect supply may not meet demand when word among the students spreads out about this.

I...I am at a loss for words. This is simply outstanding! Were students to become used to such excellence, I fear nothing less would ever satisfy them again. Fret not, however, for I shall make pains to carefully express just how special this is to them.
Ah, this is perfect! A mammet as sensitive to aether as this is sure to be highly responsive to the delicacy and precision demanded by healing magicks.

I cannot say how many more children may now have a brighter future, but know that your efforts have made a difference. I only hope that we can yet reach more young souls, that all can one day have the opportunity to learn...
Unable to obtain your reward. Your inventory is full.
To collect your reward, make room in your inventory and speak with Ameliance once more.

Perfect, this is more than enough for now. You've been such an amazing help, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I cannot think of anyone I'd rather have at my side! Thank you. Truly.

Now, I suspect most children are unaware that the legendary Warrior of Light also makes for a splendid artisanーwould you not agree? I daresay this must be rectifiedーdo forgive me if I boast the tiniest bit about you in my next letter to them.

The magical foci you delivered have been a smashing success among the students! Goodness, even my former mentor saw fit to shower me with praiseーthough, rest assured, I told him it was all thanks to you.

I just hope they can be of use to Mila as well. She seems to have some familiarity with magicks, so I've no doubt she could improve rapidly─were she able to get a solid feel for the basics. Unfortunately, this is one of those things she must come to terms with on her own, while I can only stand back and watch, desperate to help...
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I have the most wonderful news! Thanks to your efforts, the students' concerns about the cafeteria food appear to be dwindling!

I'm reminded of Alphinaud and Alisaie in their school daysーAlisaie would regularly ask me to prepare lunch for her, while Alphinaud was quite happy to sate his appetite with Archon loaf on a daily basis. ...Between you and I, he and his father are alike in just the <Emphasis>oddest</Emphasis> ways.

Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! You are dependable to a fault, my dear. Or, perhaps, as a family, we've come to rely on you too much? Fret not, however, as I believe there is a solutionーand a long overdue one at that: we should simply adopt you into the family!
...I jest, I jest. In truth, the day where Mila must return home quickly approaches, and I can't help but feel increasingly lonesome at the thought...
I'm hooome!
Ah, Mila! How was your first day of classes? Were you able to make any friends?
I was! Oh, it was so much fun! Everyone was so wonderfully kind and accepting. Everything felt so different and new, completely unlike any experiences I've had before!
That is reassuring to hear. And I must say, you wear the uniform quite well.
Heh heh, thank you! I promise you, I will repay your kindness and convince my mother to accept the path that I've chosen by mastering spellcraft ere I return home!
Convince...your mother?
For generations, my family has carried on the tradition of alchemyーand, prior to me, each generation poured their hearts and souls into the creation of medicine.
But the Final Days changed everything. I saw firsthand that there are countless lives not even the most advanced medicine can save...
That's why I decided to learn healing magicks, and why I made my way to Sharlayan. My mother was completely against it, but my father was supportive and bid me goーso I took my chances and left.
I see... Yet, even if the practice of alchemy has long been a family tradition, I see no reason why your mother should be so vehemently opposed to you studying spellcraft. Do you know why she is?
I'm not entirely sure, but...the tradition of alchemy has long been a source of pride for my family, and studying spellcraft may be perceived as me rejecting my lineage.

I am extremely proud of my family's legacy and contributions to alchemy. But if rejecting tradition means saving more lives, I will gladly make that decision. No matter what it takes, I will return home after, and <Emphasis>only</Emphasis> after I've mastered the curative arts!

Yet, with all that said, I hardly know left from right when it comes to spellcraft, as I've only just begun learning. I'm surprised the Studium even accepted my application for study abroad in the first place.
Thank you for sharing your story with us, Mila. Know that you have our full support, and that for our part, we will endeavor to make this experience a fulfilling one.
You are too kind, Lady Ameliance! As a beginner, I know I have a lot of ground to make up, but I refuse to remain stuck behind my peers. I'm gonna give it my all!
Why hello there, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I didn't realize you were in the neighborhood.

I heard you were the gracious soul who's been procuring all sorts of things for myself and the other students─and while I don't know what we did to deserve such kindness, I want you to know that your support means a lot to us. So...thank you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!
Well then, I'd better be offーa lot of spells to practice, and so little time. Can't drag my feet lest I get left behind my peers, after all!
Ah, just a moment, Mila!
I couldn't help but notice that you seem a touch less cheerful than usual... Pray tell, is something the matter?
Wh-What do you mean? I'm actually feeling better than usual, all thanks to how well everyone's been treating me!
...Are you sure? The gauntness of your cheeks indicates otherwise.
As best as I can tell, you've been enjoying the meals here at home with a healthy appetite, but I cannot speak for elsewhere... How have meals at the Studium been?
U-Um...

Aha! As I thought. Believe it or not, meals at the Studium cafeteria were considered <Emphasis>gruesome</Emphasis>ーto put it lightlyーeven in the days when I attended. And as a Sharlayan, that's saying something.
Pray forgive me for not noticing sooner, my dear. From now on, I will prepare a lunch for you!
Wh-What?! No, no, I couldn't bear to inconvenience you any further than I already am!
Please, you are family. Inconvenience? 'Tis nothing of the sort.
Right then! I would love to learn how to cook some Thavnairian dishes, if you would be my teacher? Come, let us be off to the kitchen!
L-Lady Ameliance! We servants would be happy to serve anything you wishーpray leave the cooking to us!

Thank you, Meryld, but that won't be necessaryーI do have <Emphasis>some</Emphasis> experience in the kitchen. In our school days, I would oft prepare a lunch box for Fourchenaultーmalnutrition may have claimed his life had I not, taken with Archon's loaf as he was.
Nowーlet us cook up a storm, shall we Mila?
Y-Yes!
B-But! Lady Ameliance, p-please reconsider!
Perfect timing as always, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. There is a matter I wish to discuss with you.
It is about Mila...I fear she may be having difficulty gaining a proper grasp on spellcraft.
'Tis a complex art that cannot be learned in a short amount of timeーnor can it be learned through pure effort. No, there must be a knack for it.
Fortunately, I believe Mila has this knack. Furthermore, she appears to understand the theory behind magick, and possesses a strong desire to succeed.
However, it is the latter quality in particular which worries me... With each day that passes, she returns home later and later.

Lest you wonder, she always sends word in advanceーever considerate of others, that one. If only she would shift some of that consideration to her own wellbeing... Even today she notified me that she would be studying on campus until late.

I understand her desire to prove herself, but what kind of personーno, motherーwould I be if I stood by and watched as she works herself to the point of collapse? I must talk with her face to face before she injures herself.
You may think me overprotective, but I consider this my duty...as a mother, and as a friend.
...Ahem, that said, the Studium is rather large, is it not? I would be eternally grateful if you would accompany me while I look for her, if it is not too much to ask?
You are too kind! Just say the word when you are ready to departーI am ready to leave at a moment's notice.

Lady Ameliance, Meryld, and <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>... Though my time here in Sharlayan was short, full glad am I that I was able to spend it with you. There are no words with which I can adequately express my immense gratitude.
My, how the time fliesーit feels as though you walked through the front door just yesterday... I will miss you dearly, Mila, but I know from experience how your parents must be feeling.

I know I have said it many times, but please let me say it once more: thank youーfrom the bottom of my heart. If not for your support, countless students never would've been able to study abroadーmyself included. We owe you a great debt of gratitude for everything you've done for us.
I don't even want to imagine how my studies would've turned out had it not been for the amazing resources <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> and my lovely host family prepared...
While I don't quite having something to offer as thanks, I do have something to show you.
Here I go...!
(Now fall, just like in practice...!)
That was amazing! You had perfect control over it!
Oh, I'm just getting started...
Mila...! Howー<Emphasis>when</Emphasis> did you learn to wield healing magicks?
Ah, but that is beside the point. This is the fruit borne of your hard workーand I could not be prouder of you!

Heh heh. thank you! But I didn't make it this far by myself. I have <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> to thank for crafting countless spectacular mammets, the professors at the Studium for their instruction, and you most of all for your advice, and for always believing in me, Lady Ameliance!
There is something you should know. ...I've decided to pursue alchemy when I return home.
By studying the art of spellcraft, I feel that I've come to understand the advantages and disadvantages inherent between the two disciplines.

It was when I first made this realization that an idea sprung to mindーwhat if I were to master <Emphasis>both</Emphasis> disciplines? I could compensate for the weaknesses of one with the strengths of the other, and help even more people that way!
So, I guess what I'm trying to say is...once I finish my training with alchemy, I <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> return to these shores! This, I promise you, Lady Ameliance!
When that day comes, may I come see you again?
Oh, Mila! You hardly need ask! It's a promiseーso don't keep me waiting too long, okay?
Ah, there was just one other matter. Everyone in the household came together to prepare a parting gift for youーI do hope you'll like it.
Oh my gosh, these clothes...they're so beautiful I could cry! But I mustn't or I'll ruin them! Thank you, thank you, thank you everyone!
As a master artisan, what do you think, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Do they suit me?

I am thrilledーif not a touch relievedーthat you've taken a liking to them. As we went about designing and weaving your new vestments, we carried hope in our hearts that your future would be the bright one you deserve.
I will treasure itーall of it. These lovely clothes, my experience here, everyone I met...all of it, I will treasure forever.
Miss Miladeen, I'm afraid the time of your ship's departure draws near. We had best be setting off.
Oh... I knew this moment would come, but even so I'm not prepared to the say the words. And after receiving a gift as lovely and thoughtful as this... <sniff>
Everyone, I...I love you all so much! Thank you a million times over for everything!
We love you too, Mila. Safe travels, and know that we will always be thinking of you. May your journey in life be one full of smiles and laughterーthe selfsame gift you brought to all of us.
I'll do my best! Until we meet again!
There must be other students from abroad who, just like Mila, are coming to terms with wielding spellcraft for the first time.

And so I come to you with a proposition: I would like you to procure magical foci and toads to assist students in wielding magicks. The better the quality, the more quickly students will be able to master the basics. What do you say?
I knew I could rely on you! Thank you as always, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

<sigh> If only I'd noticed sooner, she wouldn't have had to suffer so. Even in the best of circumstances, 'tis not uncommon for one to miss the nostalgic taste of homeーbut to be faced with Sharlayan cuisine of all things...

It breaks my heart to think that there may be other students suffering in silence just as Mila was. I will caution the other host families to be particularly mindful when it comes to matters of nourishment, just to be safe.

On a related note, I wish to ask a favor of you. Passionate students such as Mila are like as not to be out studying from the first class in the morning till well after the last bell, soーif you can spare the timeーI would like you to prepare aetherothermal lunch boxes capable of preserving food for hours on end.
It never gets easier to watch them walk away. No matter how many times I experience it.

But I should not burden you with such musingsーcertainly not when I have good news to share! Several host families have informed me that the students in their care were able to enjoy their stay in Sharlayan and return home safelyーand we owe it all to you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
Our success here has inspired me to expand my support activities beyond Sharlayan's bordersーthere must be more that I can do to give even more children the opportunity to learn, I just know it.
That is not to say I will not be accepting more students for homestayーfar from it!
Just imagine the look on Fourchenault and the twins' faces when they return home only to find a complete stranger living hereーyes, I do think I will keep this program a secret for some time longer.
Ah, and before I forget, I have a little something for youーdo you recall the outfit we made for Mila? We were actually in the midst of preparing one for you too.
We ended up preparing hers firstーwhat with her needing to return homeーbut yours is almost ready. I hope you don't mind waiting a few moments longer.

And, while I have you, there was one final matterーsomething I'd like to keep just between us. Should you happen across any apparel that you think might suit me during your travels, do bring them here. If it's something that will make Fourchenault blush, all the better!
Ameliance is pleased with your efforts. She now considers you a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Partner to the Leveilleurs<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!

Ameliance is delighted with your efforts. She now considers you a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Benefactor of the Leveilleurs<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!

Ameliance is overjoyed with your efforts. She now considers you a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Champion of the Leveilleurs<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!

Ameliance could not be happier with your efforts. She now considers you a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Member of the Leveilleurs<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!
And yet there is still much work to be done if she is to ensure students from abroad feel at home in Old Sharlayan. To that end, Ameliance has a new favor to ask of you...
Through your efforts, the study abroad program in Old Sharlayan was a resounding success. It seems, however, that Ameliance has a different sort of favor to ask of you...

The Custom Deliveries list for Ameliance has been updated. To view the new list, speak with Ameliance and select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Make a delivery<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

A new quest continuing the story of Ameliance's efforts with the study abroad program in Old Sharlayan is now available from Ameliance. Upon its completion, the Custom Deliveries list for Ameliance will be updated.
Future requests will be selected at random from all those you have seen thus far, with the list refreshed once a week (Earth time).

You may review the items currently in demand at any time by speaking with Ameliance and selecting <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Make a delivery<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

Note that school supplies, school supply materials, and coral fragments will earn you particularly handsome rewards. Whenever they make an appearance, the effort to procure them will be worth your while.
Furthermore, Ameliance's appearance may now be altered through the use of glamours.
Thank you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Not just for procuring supplies, but for believing in my vision.
'Tis strange, don't you think? That you, a close friend of the twins, and I, their mother, should become acquaintances like this. But I couldn't ask for a better partner.
Thank you for an incredible week of deliveries, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Know that your efforts have not gone unappreciated.

Were Fourchenault to step through the door right now and see that we've become friends, he would doubtlessly need to sit down for a moment to process the revelation. ...I admit, the thought of it is so amusing, I rather wish it would happen!
Your generosity knows no bounds, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I cannot thank you enough.
I promise I'm not saying this to embarrass you, but each time you visit, the house servants simply radiate with excitementーyour very presence is an inspiration!

When I first married into the Leveilleur family, the servants patiently taught me all of the fancy etiquette and mannerisms expected of a lady of the house. When the twins were born, they spared no effort in helping me look after them. I am thankful for their presence, each and every day.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, do you have a moment to spare?
I received a letter from Alphinaud, and was hesitant as to whether or not I should mention that you and I have begun working together when I write back to him.
I was planning to keep it a secret and surprise him the next time he visits, but...I do not think Alisiae would take kindly to such an abrupt revelation. Any suggestions?
'Tis good to see you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
Can I confess something to you? When I first began this enterprise, I was riddled with doubt...but then you came, and offered your help. In that moment, all of my doubt washed away.
I now understand how Alphinaud and Alisaie have felt about you for all these years. With you by my side, I feel like anything is possibleーso try not to stray too far, would you?
Forgive me, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, but do you have a moment? Lest you worry, it's nothing serious. I just...want to thank you. For everything.

I am thankful from the bottom of my heart to have had this opportunity to not only work with you as a partner, but to get to know you as a person and friend. But more than anything, I want to thank you for what you've done for Alphinaud, Alisaie, and yes, Fourchenault.
You've protected the ones dearest to me through thick and thinーgiven me the faith to believe that they would always return home, no matter how dangerous the mission.

And now, you are important to me. I know better than to tell you not to do anything recklessーyou'll always do whatever it takes to protect those in need, no matter the risks. But if I could ask one thing of you, it would be that you stop by and visit after one of your grand adventuresーjust to let me know you're okay.
Ah, but look at me prattle onーyou'd better flee before I talk your ear off. Just rememberーyou are always welcome here.

You have delivered the weekly maximum of six items to Ameliance. You may begin making deliveries again starting <ResetTime>1203</ResetTime><Switch(TopLevelParameter(220))><Case(1)>Sunday</Case><Case(2)>Monday</Case><Case(3)>Tuesday</Case><Case(4)>Wednesday</Case><Case(5)>Thursday</Case><Case(6)>Friday</Case><Case(7)>Saturday</Case></Switch> at <If(TopLevelParameter(218))><Switch(TopLevelParameter(218))><Case(1)>1</Case><Case(2)>2</Case><Case(3)>3</Case><Case(4)>4</Case><Case(5)>5</Case><Case(6)>6</Case><Case(7)>7</Case><Case(8)>8</Case><Case(9)>9</Case><Case(10)>10</Case><Case(11)>11</Case><Case(12)>12</Case><Case(13)>1</Case><Case(14)>2</Case><Case(15)>3</Case><Case(16)>4</Case><Case(17)>5</Case><Case(18)>6</Case><Case(19)>7</Case><Case(20)>8</Case><Case(21)>9</Case><Case(22)>10</Case><Case(23)>11</Case></Switch><Else/>12</If> <If(GreaterThanOrEqualTo(TopLevelParameter(218),12))>p.m.<Else/>a.m.</If> (Earth time).
I feel more confident already, knowing you'll be with me. Just say the word when you're ready to depart.
In order to undertake the next quest, speak with Ameliance as a Disciple of the Hand or the Land.
